node.title: 'He told me he was bored': Rare insight into youth crime as TikTok, Instagram videos go viral
node.alt: An unidentified man stands, holding bars in front of him
node.description: The father of an 11-year-old Kimberley boy in videosÂ showing cars doing donuts and kids taking them on joy rides speaks about the reason behind the behaviour that has sparked concern for the community and the young children involved.
node.content:
["Jack\u00a0is the father of an 11-year-old Kimberley boy and says his story started off similar to many other children in remote northern Australia.", "\"I think he just got caught up with a group of boys that were known to police and the community to be troublemakers,\" Jack*\u00a0said.", "Jack's son recently came into his care after a childhood typical of the Kimberley; one touched by alcohol abuse and domestic violence, all the while living in one of the most isolated places in the state.", "At just 10 years old the boy was already facing charges like criminal destruction of property and aggravated burglary.", "But after nearly a year with his father, he recently graduated from a primary school, has sought help from local mental health services and has a love of playing NRL.", "It's a rare outcome for many Kimberley kids, and Jack said a recent trend has now made him reflect on just how close his son came to falling through the cracks.", "\"Some of the videos \u2026 I suppose the first thing that came into my head was how lost these kids are,\" he said.", "", "
A child behind the wheel of a car.(Supplied)
", "
Blood City Boys\u00a0
", "Children posting videos of themselves taking cars for joy rides, roaming in houses and holding up items that appear to be illegal to social media have circulated the Kimberley community in recent days, prompting a fierce community reaction against the children involved.", "It comes after nearly a year\u00a0of repeated spikes in juvenile crime in the Kimberley region, with the newest videos offering the community a direct outlet to vent their frustration over the last 12 months.", "The videos sparked an operation between Broome and Derby detectives, who were tasked with investigating dozens of videos posted to social media by children referring to themselves as the 'Blood City Boys'.", "WA Police Kimberley superintendent Craig Parkin said police were aware of the videos before they came to community attention, and had already had discussions with social media platforms about monitoring and taking them down.", "", "
WA Police Kimberley Superintendent Craig Parkin.
", "\"Every social media organisation has their own standards around that, so a lot of these [pages] are shut down quickly,\" he said.", "The accounts, which show children driving off-road through bush tracks and cars painted with their postcodes before being arrested by police, have been shared widely in the Kimberley.", "In the comments of one social media post, residents posted death threats and abuse directed at the children involved.", "", "
A child flashes money at the camera in a video posted to social media.(Supplied)
", "Superintendent Parkin said it was clear the video's circulation had been met with considerable anger within the community.", "Youth advocate and Walmatjarri woman Tallulah Bieundurry said the reaction to the videos had been hard to witness.", "", "
Broome woman Tallulah Bieundurry(ABC Kimberley: Erin Parke\u00a0)
", "\"There's a disconnect, because if you're able to make a threat or say something like that, then you feel disconnected from this person,\" she said.", "
A struggle against the system
", "The Kimberley is home to some of the highest fetal alcohol syndrome rates in the country, and a lack of support services for children has been highlighted time and time again by advocacy groups and the WA Government's own departments.", "The Kimberley Juvenile Justice Strategy is a Labor government initiative aimed at tackling youth crime, with funding divided between\u00a0night patrol groups and PCYCs.", "However, in some parts of the region, school attendance remains at record lows and children increasingly wander the streets as a means to get away from their homes.", "Ms Bieundurry said it was frustrating to see some people judge without context.", "\"Your kids maybe are fortunate enough to have stable homes and a stable environment.", "\"[These kids] have got to know that [they're] worth something. There's somebody in the world who cares about you and people who want you to do well.\"", "", "
Jack said while his son was now on the straight and narrow, it took a monumental effort from his family and friends to speak with him and find out his needs.(Andrew Seabourne)
", "Jack said his personal experience as the father of a juvenile offender has also coloured how he viewed\u00a0the children caught up in the recent trend.", "\"The first time I got wind of him getting in trouble I had a discussion with him on the phone, and I asked him why he was doing this,\" he said.", "\"And he told me he was bored.\"", "*Name changed for legal reasons"]
